page.title: 02LHANBRYDE_ECOLOGY
page.content: The Crooked Wood is used by all ages,and its{trees,}all around 30yrs old,are mainly:Scots Pine _ with S.Birch and some Rowan to the east _ and a few broad leaf trees to the west (where it meets the Lhanbryde Burn). { Footpaths}criss_cross it and there's a permanent orienteering course to suit all standards of ability and fitness.In 2 places it reaches 20m in height.{Lhanbryde Primary School}hold their annual{cross country race}there. There are many{creatures} :rabbits, squirrels,roe deer,owls,ants,shrews, crossbills,rooks and magpies. There are lots of {wild flowers and {plants}:sorrel,foxgloves,wood rush, heather,willow herb and nettles. In the autumn there is a beautiful crop of{fungi}:fly agaric,death cap, parasols,chanterelle,roof nail,witches butter and bracket fungus
